qas.question: What appeared at the end of the late Eastern Han period?
What script was traditionally attributed to Liu Desheng?
Who showed examples of early semi-cursive script?

context: By the late Eastern Han period, an <a0_0>early form of semi-cursive script<a0_0/> appeared, developing out of a cursively written form of neo-clerical script[c] and simple cursive. This <a1_0>semi-cursive<a1_0/> script was traditionally attributed to Liu Desheng c. 147–188 AD,[d] although such attributions refer to early masters of a script rather than to their actual inventors, since the scripts generally evolved into being over time. <a2_0>Qiu<a2_0/> gives examples of early semi-cursive script, showing that it had popular origins rather than being purely Liu’s invention.
